function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Exposure to 222 nm far-uvc light in public places","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous far-uvc exposure at regulatory limits","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to far-uvc light","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate regulatory dose limits","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Propagation of viral strains in human cell lines.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Generation and exposure of viral aerosols in an aerosol irradiation chamber.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to aerosolized viruses in the uv exposure chamber","category":"Air","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection of the uv exposure chamber","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient dosimetry of the uv exposure chamber","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to high-intensity uv radiation","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased transmission of uv radiation through plastic windows","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Aerosol particle exposure to high uv dose","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to aerosolized virus particles during the experimental protocol","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Handling virus infectivity assays without proper safety protocols","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to virus during the experiment","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contamination of laboratory surfaces and equipment","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incorrect calculation of tcid 50 and pfu/ml","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Working in a laboratory setting with human cells and viruses poses a risk of accidental exposure and transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to contagious viruses during experimental studies on virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient data and small sample sizes leading to unreliable estimates of virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential flaws in statistical analyses and modeling of virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through wearable technology","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Biosurveillance concerns with wearable devices providing detailed health data","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data privacy and security issues","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Privacy and data security risks with wearable technology","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The indoor spread of covid-19 due to reduced outdoor ventilation and increased social interactions in cooler weather.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 via droplet, contact, and airborne routes in indoor environments.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to monitor co2 levels to indicate ventilation provision can lead to increased risk of covid-19 transmission via the airborne route.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate outdoor air supply can increase the risk of covid-19 transmission via the airborne route.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in sars-cov-2 viral load distributions and respiratory droplet size distributions for various activities and individuals","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the trajectory of droplets and aerosols containing viral particles under different environmental conditions and ventilation modes","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 in indoor spaces with high occupancy density and inadequate ventilation.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-adherence to florence nightingale’s design principles for indoor environments, such as high ceilings, natural lighting, and ventilation.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for new and transmissible sars-cov-2 variants in indoor spaces.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of respiratory infections via droplet, contact, and airborne routes","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of direct empirical evidence on airborne transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation provision due to tightly constructed buildings and space restrictions.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transport and advection of aerosols and bio-aerosols within the indoor environment.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of respiratory diseases via droplets and aerosols","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting the physical processes crucial to droplet evolution within an indoor environment.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misunderstanding the distinction between droplet transmission and airborne transmission.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate investigation of droplets and aerosols produced by expiratory events such as coughing and sneezing.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 by pre-symptomatic and asymptomatic carriers through speech droplets and aerosols.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Production of a wide range of droplet sizes during conversational speech.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High particle emissions during speech and coughing","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Super-emitters consistently releasing a large number of particles","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased droplet size and number during speech, especially after eating","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of airborne transmission of contagious diseases through respiratory droplets","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of transmission via surface contacts and fomites","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of sars-cov-2 through surface contacts and fomites","category":"Air","confidence":"High"}]}
